page.title: 11Children's Hobbies.
page.content: Paul Watts goes to Judo. He says it is hard work and it can be dangerous. He says, "Sometimes I go out and explore the wonderful wild life around Summerhill. It is a very pleasant place indeed and only a small village. There is hardly any noise there. We have a shop and a playing field." He has a hamster called Trixy a dog called Scamp a cat called Smokey and two goldfishes called Tipsy and Turby and a rabbit called Thumper. Hazel Watts' uncle keeps pigs. Kerry Morgan came from Scotland and likes running in races. David Richardson likes swimming. He can swim 200 metres of the back stroke. Philip's favourite place is the beach. He is 7. Melany Davies is 9 and she goes to the lst Summerhill Brownies. She says, "It is fun." Martin lives in a farm. He feeds the hens, rabbits and ducks.
